text: Jeffrey Cooper, manager of Olive Garden in Fairview Heights made our experience unforgettable.  I am completely amazed by his kindness and accommodations.  I have never had THAT great of a lunch.  Thank you to him and the staff who blessed us.  The food was perfect.

This was my first time to Bevi Seafood and it didn't disappoint! You order at the register. I got my two poboys to go. Jessica was very helpful. I asked if they made their roast beef and I love that they put their beef on the side. They do this so that your bread doesn't get too soggy by the time you get home. Very smart! Another interesting thing they do differently than any other place in New Orleans, they have a horseradish mayonnaise! Delish! My other poboy was the oyster dressed! Overstuffed, big juicy oysters! Just how I like them! If you like sliced pickles on your poboy, Bevi has really good nice sized slices of dill. 
I split the two so that I could taste both and they were both so good and they hit the spot! To top everything off I had a Barq's Red Cream Soda! Love a Barq's!
Half the restaurant were already eating crawfish! They looked really good with celery and all. I'll have to go back soon with friends and enjoy some with a cold beer or two!

A couple of friends and I went to Acropolis around 5pm on a Sunday evening. Although the parking lot is small and shared with other businesses, there was plenty of parking available. It seemed to be the perfect time to visit. 

Our waiter was fantastic! He was great at explaining the menu and giving suggestions. They had a 4 course special for $19.99 with several soup, salad and entree choices. I went with the 6 onion soup, Greek salad and an entree which name I cannot pronounce or remember. I'm not a soup person, so wasn't really feeling the soup. The salad was excellent! I will return for that alone. The entree was a flounder fish wrapped in pastry crust with a side of vegetables. The fish was big and thick. Personally, I prefer thinner pieces of fish. It had a good, distinct flavor in some portions and was lacking flavor in other portions. If the flavor would have carried all the way through, I would have loved it. I chose baklava for dessert and it was really good. I paid extra for a shot of Greek coffee (similar to espresso). It was different and strong, but I enjoyed it. I'd definitely be willing to return and try something different.

We will highly recommend Lucatelli's. The prices are great for the city. It really tasted incredible. Team are incredibly lovely and service is really quick. Certainly worth checking out if you're in the area.

The place was nice and presentable.
Fairly priced and was not crowded.
Overall bfast was lacking.
And service, well they had one waiter for the whole place.

This is my go-to store for music.  The selection there is second-to-none for this area and the staff are knowledgeable on every genre it seems.  They've also got a great selection of limited-edition releases, music DVDs, imports and music magazines.  They've recently added vinyl and do a good job each Record Store Day.  

The main reason I knock them a star is their pricing.  You have to pay $10/yr to be able to buy new releases at what should be their normal price.  The other reason I held back on a 5-star rating is that their Used CD section could be better organized.

Consider me underwhelmed.

Zack read that this place was on some "Best Breweries in the Country" list which I am starting to not believe. Had it bookmarked for months and finally stopped by before a show at Ardmore Music Hall (right across the street).

The place is big! No need for a tour, really, as you're right in the middle of the brewery "in-action," or at least that's what it feels like. It was fairly packed on a Friday night and it was loud. High ceilings. You know.

Zack and I shared a tasty burger ($10, with bacon, cheese, and fries). It was on the smaller side, but a steal for the price. The only problem? It was well-done. No room for requesting temperatures here, as they state on the menu "no additions no substitutions," which frankly always puts a sour taste in my mouth. We also enjoyed a cherry and grilled radicchio salad, which was interesting. Nothing about these items made me jump up and down, until we had dessert. 

The best part of the meal was the ice cream sandwich, which we (regretfully) shared four ways with our double date. Better to split in half, if you ask me!

As far as the beer goes: they don't do flights. I tried a few 4-ouncers, but didn't fall in love. If you live in Ardmore, I can see how this place would be super exciting. I thought it was A-OK.

The place to go for deep dish. Nice ambiance, good beer selection. Not too overpriced fro state Street food. Deep dish was tasty, think crust had good consistency. Fresh toppings. The burrata bruscheta deconstructed dish was simple yet tasty.

My boyfriend and I were a little skeptical of this place due to it's not so favorable location. However, one day we gave it a try and we are so very thankful! I think Terryin's chinese offerings are much better than the sushi. Their orange chicken is the best I've tasted in this city. So crunchy and flavorful. This alone makes me such a huge fan! The sushi is not bad but not amazing either. Terryin is now my go-to place for convenient and delicious chinese food!
Ok I have been back despite the bad service I got the first time I went. Awesome cafe in the back with great ready made food. My new favorite go-to lunch cafe for healthy eats and treats. Love love!

I ordered Blackened catfish topped with Shrimp Creole red sauce over bed of rice, corn & French bread plus A cup of Seafood Gumbo. Food is always great here. They have a large selection on their menu plus often add more. Service was excellent with awareness to your table needs.

Went to the Trolley Car Diner for brunch today.  I am obsessed with breakfast- so I like that they serve breakfast all day long.  Pretty decent diner fare and a lot of choices on the menu.

I got a broccoli and cheese omelet with potato pancakes.  The potato pancakes were small and crispy and were absolutely delicious.  I was glad I chose them over home fries.  Definitely recommend!  The omelet was good as well.  The only thing I didn't like was that they put ice in my orange juice.  That was weird.  My boyfriend got the vegetarian chili and he enjoyed it.

Overall, it was good.  The service is a little spotty though.  Our waitress was MIA for most of the meal, forgot the cheese on the chili, forgot drink orders, etc.  It wasn't even crowded, due to the snow.  Oh well, I would go here again if I was in the area and in the mood for diner food.

We were originally trying to go to Hattie Bs but seeing a line wrapped around the building we came here.  Went on Saturday during the brunch, I had the salmon omelet which was delicious, my husband got the hot chicken sandwich with fried okra - both were amazing!  The white sauce they have on the table is great and they had a good selection for beers.

The pizza was good, but they messed up everything, which is disappointing because the one in Holiday, fl is awesome. I ordered the box special with pretzel crust... wasn't pretzel crust... it was crust with salt on it. The MILD Buffalo wings were actually BURNING hot (I know hot, and love it but my fiance does not), and the Parmesan bread was so dry that even the marinara sauce didn't help.  They kinda burnt it and left it under a lamp for too long. Man :( The 2 stars is for the actual pizza minus the crust.
Unbelievable ice cream, brownie blitz is unbelievable. Also the chocolate Elvis is something that you need to try.

We enjoyed a delicious dinner at Zaytoon this last week. We tried the Halloumi cheese as an appetizer, and were so impressed with the intelligence and complexity of the flavors. This dish surprised us and was a great refreshing appetizer on a very hot day. We shared the Meshawi Combo and Vegetarian Feast for our main course, and everything was excellent. We were so impressed with the quality of the food; we ate until we were well past full. For dessert we enjoyed the Layali Lubnan, a Lebanese pudding. The flavors were so exotic and surprising, like eating perfume pudding - it was incredible. We cannot wait to return to Santa Barbara to eat here again!

3.5 stars. Saw the fucker in half Yelp.

I went in here for the Dock St UYE that the mighty Bill McThrill put together. Since I was one of the first to arrive besides Master McThrill I sat down and ordered a beer. The first beer I got tasted funny, like the tap wasn't clean. The second beer(a pale ale I believe) was better but nothing spectacular. 

We moved on to a set of tables after a bunch of fellow Yelpers arrived. Then things started hopping. Appetizers were passed around. The fried leeks and fries were delicious.  the Prince Myshkin Russian Imperial Stout was very very tasty. The flammenkuche pizza was also good. The sauce was decent and the crust was thin and tasty. The toppings were also pretty good. I tried some other peoples pizza and was less enthusiastic about what they got, though the names escape me due to the aformentioned Imperial Stout.

Overall it seemed like a nice place with pretty good service. It did get a little loud as more people filtered in, so I can imagine it would get crazy loud on the weekends. But for a Thursday night it was just right.

I love Kona ice; I've been a fan since we used them at an old job I had.
Since leaving that past job, I have not had the chance to have some delicious Kona ice since then. It was my lucky day when some friends told me that they were coming to their neighborhood. I jumped on the chance to go to the truck.
They parked on a side street and we were able to hop in line and get some good iceee treats, they had the set up that you could ask for different flavors and sizes.
It's a basic but good set up, I love the tiger's blood flavor, so I got a large size and enjoyed it.
I'm a creature of habit, but there are also a lot of flavor options, strawberry, blueberry, like, cherry.
It's a friendly group of people and they are safe and wear masks and gloves, I noticed they take cash or card when you pay for your icee. It's something the whole family can enjoy, pro tip, champagne goes well in the tigers blood flavor 
@_foogs

The food was out of this world. Service was awesome despite the fact they were busy. So great, in fact, that after appetizers I was already telling my friends that I wanted to bring them to this amazing place.

4.5 stars

I do love Nola Snow.  The owners, Rudy & MiMi, are all about New Orleans.  The staff is always friendly and if they aren't too busy, they'll answer questions about nearly every single flavor on the menu if you are having a hard time deciding on which flavor to get.

Today, we opted to get 2 kiddie sizes so that we could try 2 different flavors (all in the interests of Yelping about it).  The first flavor was yellow cake batter and I ain't kidding when I tell you that if you close your eyes and use your imagination, you'd swear you were a kid again and licking the cake batter from your momma's spatula. Well, almost!

The 2nd flavor we ordered was cream ice cream.  Since they were nearly out of this flavor the snowball server made a fresh bottle using their secret syrup and mixing it with evaporated milk.  It was awesome, and the evaporated milk gave the syrup a cream like consistency & taste.

With consistent great flavors and great service, this is my go to snowball stand; especially since they have 2 locations in Lakeview.  The only reason I give them 4.5 instead of 5 stars is that sometimes, the ice can be a little coarse and not completely velvety smooth.

However, I have yet to try a flavor that I have not liked.  But for the record NOLA nectar is the best!

Neighborhood Gem. Great company and I'm never disappointed regardless of what location I choose to visit. That being said, this is my favorite. Wonderful ambience, PERFECT location, and the staff is always fantastic. Great food and drink options, good for couples and families as well!
We spent the weekend in New Orleans and wound up going here twice! We loved it! The food was fab, the coffee was strong and the staff was warm and friendly. Long wait but worth it, yum!

This place puts me in mind of the Waffle House meets small town diner. The staff is friendly and the food is decent. I tried the biscuits and gravy. It comes with sausage patties cut up  and the gravy poured on top. The hash browns aren't homemade. Not see if the biscuits were homemade. I wasn't wowed but it wasn't bad.

Old school place.  Very festive, very friendly.  Food is authentic Italian and divine!  This was my first visit so I rolled up to this really old store front, and based on the old adage: it it looks as it its been here a while, there is probably a good reason, i strolled in.  I received a warm greeting and a hearty list of specials.  Had an opportunity to read Chef's accolades, and it appears he is exceptionally well respected by his peers and the general restaurant establishment.  I had squid ink with seafood rose.  Perfect.  Generous portions. Get out of center city and go here.  You need this.

I have been coming to Maddogs for over 8 years. The food is always good, lunch menu has all the pub hits (fish & chips, steak sandwich, and an under rated burger). This is a go to for anyone in S Tampa who is feeling a nice meal in a neighborhood setting. I like the tap beer selection and they have a good selection of wine for something sweet. Here's my three things: 

1) Always seating available and a choice of inside for a hot day or patio when its nice. I would say staff can be a bit slow but that is just pub cadence I think. 

2) Discount for service members and steady lunch selections  lots of good sides if your bored of fries. 

3) Queit neighborhood gem with live music on Saturday nights. Dinner has a seasonal rotation to it.

My boyfriend and I love places like this because they serve both my vegan needs and his meat-loving tastes. However, this does not rank high on our list of favorites. He seemed to enjoy his food more than me. He ordered a sandwich and I ordered a custom personal pizza with vegan garlic knots to share (all placed on the same bill). First, his food was done twenty minutes before mine. I insisted he started eating because it was best to eat while hot, but eventually he started getting annoyed for me that my food wasn't here yet. We saw other people who had ordered after us get their food. Thankfully he is a really slow eater, so when my food was finally ready, he was only halfway through his sandwich. The pizza I got had the droopiest crust I've ever seen - it was nearly impossible to hold up a slice. Otherwise, the taste was good though. Some of the garlic knots were burnt. Everything tasted good enough - there were just problems we couldn't really help but notice. Our order seemed pricier than it should have been, considering what we received. I give three stars because he loved his sandwich and while my food tasted fine, it had problems.
Delicious, pretty, great customer service. Excellent community outreach. Lovely dining area! The adjoining store is a great place to purchase bath and body and gifts!

Nice place, classy like other Bob's I've tried. Just stopped in for a drink and a free valet parking validation. The $15 total I paid would have been my parking garage costs anyway since there is no parking downtown here. The Expresso Martini was smooth, but needed a touch more Bailey's IMHO...

I love kolaches but the experience leaves something to be desired. We usually eat them there, but maybe it's best to nuke them at home. Between the two of us we had a total of six Kolaches: ranchero (somewhat spicy), 2 egg/cheese/sausage (sausage heavy on the sage), pecan pie and cream cheese. The pastry is so unique and it tastes good with everything. Disappointed they didn't automatically give my companion the ranchero/coffee combo price but it was only .20 less, so not a big deal. They have done away with the soda fountain and now serve only bottled Coke and Prairie farm products. Katz coffee is self-serve from big air pots. I found the giant napkin dispensers on each table too functional; made it feel like Sam's club.

I have been thinking about what to write for a review for this place for about a year and as you will find, I haven't come up with much because it's just that F'n awesome.  I have been literally rendered speechless up until now.

In a world that has gone burger crazy, there are a lot of good burger places now-a-days. I like to categorize the burger restaurant industry into three categories: 
1. Chain fast food joints, you know what you're gonna get, and you're going to get it fast.  Some people look down upon such places but hey they fulfill a need.
2. Sit down restaurants that serve burgers, the burgers are usually those 8oz huge burgers and you pay a load for it because you're sitting in a restaurant and it's usually ok, but their focus isn't really about the burger.
3. Those places that only do burgers and do burgers well.  That's what category the Habit is in.  Sure they do other stuff, but why would you go there and order anything else but a charburger?  I honestly think they put the stuff on the menu because they had the extra space on the menu board or they had the lettuce for the burgers on hand anyway, so why not offer a salad. Sell one a day maybe to satisfy that weird-o vegetarian in the group.  Or maybe you're on some sort of self depravation, masochistic work-out/diet regiment that renders you temporarily insane and you go to the Habit and DON'T order a burger, whatever - point being go here and order a burger.  
Like I said, the burgers are awesome, cooked medium, fresh ingredients, grilled onions, and best of all - they have bacon.  BACON makes everything taste better, and in this case it takes an already awesome burger and makes it... more awesome.  The fries are crispy and fresh and I haven't figured out why they are so good, but I'm going with CRACK.  They must put CRACK on their fries or something else as addicting and pleasure inducing.
The chain isn't in San Diego yet, their website says two locations coming soon to SD, until then I will always stop here when visiting family in Santa Barbara.

This place is beautiful on the outside and the inside. The house margaritas are decent and the tacos are over-priced but delicious and well considered. The majority of the clientele are affluent Broadripple-Now-MassAve-And-Soon-To-Be-FletcherPlace-or-FountainSquare Converts (aka douches) formerly seen in the college bars along 62nd St. Or on S. Meridian -- Go on a week night and you're ok. Weekends become insane, good luck getting drink orders in or 3 word conversation from the wait staff (though I feel for them and completely get it)

HOW AND WHY does this place have 4 stars???? I'm a southerner, but still... We asked the very uninterested waiter what they're known for. He said the brisket. HOW????!!!!!! IT WAS SO DRY and UNSEASONED it was inedible. 

The only reason I'm giving it two stars is the fried biscuits with apple butter. Oh em gee! Yummy! I'm glad because they salvaged the evening.
In the farmers market, a nice place for its fresh juices. They have a variety of other things for sale there as well, but I have had their juices. The prices are on the high end.

Waited 45 min Thursday evening for 2 burgers.  Line was not long.   It was insane waiting that long after I placed my order   The employee told me on line orders take precedent.   I will never get that hour back.  Then when got home burger was hot-fries were cold.   Never again

This place is cool and fun but not the most authentic BBQ. It's more of a hipster BBQ place. One weird thing about Nashville BBQ is they put pickles on pulled pork sandwiches, I still don't understand this. For me their sauce is spicier than I like. I prefer NC sweet BBQ sauce. The one dish I do love at Edleys is the Nachos with pulled pork. Not a traditional dish in any way. The chips are house made thick cut potato chips. The dish is covered with nacho cheese, BBQ sauce, tomato/onion salsa and meat. Great flavor and addictive.

This place is horrible.  It is a tourist trap. We got dropped off by our tour guide and we all got suckered in. We paid $16 per person and the place is old and the servers are rude. The food is too greasy and oil glistened on everything. Please close it down!!

We are so happy to have found this delicious restaurant! We went in looking for ceviche and were so delighted w this fabulous place! So many choices; service was terrific; dishes served eloquently n tasted perfect! Can't wait to come in for their special Ceviche night. We sat on their front patio w our doggy, Sammy. All was great!

Ok... I have been to China Yuan for Dim Sum several times, and loved every bit of it. I have always wanted to try them for dinner. Tonight I did... and that was after reading all the Yelp reviews So I would have some ideas what to order.

I ended up with a combo, Honey BBQ pork and Crispy Skin pork. With Rice and some lovely baby Bok Choy.

New favorite.... the Honey BBQ pork is phenomenal, tasty, smokey, tender... so very good! I let my girlfriend have a bite of it, and I thought she was going to jump up and wrestle me for the rest of it. She really like it also! (Thank Coty... you are right, it rocks!)

The Crispy Skin Pork is something I also love, and even make it at home occasionally. Properly cooked pork belly is a thing of beauty, and this was definitely a pageant winner! Succulent, tender, with a dusting of five spice powder, and just a thin layer of ultra crispy pork skin... YUM! Girlfriend was not as fond of this... a texture thing for her, although she loved the flavor.

Rice was good, and the Bok Choy was yummy with a drizzle of some sauce over it, not sure what it was, but good.

Girlfriend ordered Sesame Chicken... and enjoyed it!  It was very good, although severely lacking in spicy heat (and yes, it is supposed to be spicy!) But they had some good chili oil on the table, fixed that right up!

We had ordered Jasmine tea also... and it was very good.

Services was excellent... the lady who waited on us was wonderful. I even got fortune cookies (see a earlier review for another place to see why I say that!)  :)

All in all... great Chinese (Cantonese) food, and I even ordered a large portion of the Honey Pork to take to work with me tomorrow, to share with co-workers! They are in for a tasty surprise!

After we left China Yuan, we wandered to the Chinese bakery that is nearby, and I got a sausage and scallion bun, a crispy pork bun, and a butter cream bun to go. Ate the Butter Cream bun for dessert, and will have the others for breakfast tomorrow. 

Highly recommended!

Very disappointing lunch.  Ordered a turkey & Swiss sandwich on Rye bread with lettuce, tomato and honey mustard.  Received a sandwich on very stale white bread and NO honey mustard.  And they had no plain or baked potato chip options.  All flavors that I don't like.  The lady at the counter was so rude and not friendly at all that I just didn't have the energy to complain...
They had some big parties so we had to wait awhile, but all in all the service was good and so was the food.  I really love their chicken taco's. They are always very nice to their customers.

Not sure what everybody else's problem is... I think the food is just fine! I personally like the "no meato burrito", the "honey lime burrito" and their quesadillas! There is an ENORMOUS selection of hot sauces from all over! The manager is super nice too, he recognized us, very outgoing. There is a nice atmosphere too. I'd liken

We came here on a Saturday night to the early seating and did not have to wait very long to get in since we got there about 15 minutes early. We were seated at a great table with a great view. Our server was good, but they were out of many of the items on the menu (and we were the first seating of the night). Also, once the show started, she barely came around.

The show itself was awesome and the atmosphere was great! There were 4 artists who all had written songs for famous people. Their own music and voices were also great. We took our kids and they had high chairs and one artist even snag a children's song (coincidence). this would have been a 5 star review had the menu been fully available as the food was decent.

Taking Brianna, the server's, advice, we ordered the pimento stuffed beignets and the crispy pig ears (sweet and sour) as appetizers.  I was a little bit skeptical until I tasted them both.  Brianna's suggestions were spot on!  

I would have been fine just with the appetizers, but they brought out the "farm animal of the day" which was duck on a bed of farm greens.  The golden beets were delicious.

We also had the springer hot chicken which was really good.  It came with finger potatoes that were really good.

I loved that it was "country" inspired food.  You know, good southern cooking, but it was taken to a higher plane!

Chicken parm hoagie sucked, it was made with chicken tenders instead of a whole slice of chicken not much sauce or mozzarella cheese. The pizza sauce was better almost smell like there was bleach on it. Will never order from here again. If you want something good just go to Zesto!

Today was our first visit. The food was really good. I ordered the eggs Florentine and hubby enjoyed the southern scramble. The portions are large. The only negative is the service is slow but hopefully with time that will improve. We will definitely be back.

Absolutely amazing crepes, made with amazing ingredients. Le Creperie Cafe's crepes are some of the most authentic I've had this side of Paris. 

Service is quick and friendly, and the atmosphere is cafe-cute. Bonus for their French pop and lounge music.

Most crepes will average you $8 - $13, so I wouldn't call this place expensive, at all.
The cake here is amazing! Very friendly customer service. I ordered my wedding cake from here today. Haven't got it in just yet, but I'll update this when I do. So far so good!
Wonderful dinner on Saturday after Mass. Thoroughly enjoyed the house wine and the Chicken Marsala.  Thanks to Barry

This place had been in my New Orleans bookmarks for the longest, and I finally got to check it out. Worked out perfectly since it's right down the street from my hotel. The service was so quick; we got our food in no time! Some things on the menu are a bit over priced, but the portion sizes are large and fill you up. 

I had the Crab Cake Benedict which was amazing and so rich in flavor. And the strawberries on the side were so sweet and fresh! This is a great spot for a filling, wholesome breakfast and has a lively interior design.

Dirtiest Burger King ever. Only one customer and every table gross. Floors were sticky with spilled old soda and fries not just under the tables but in the aisles. Can't imagine what the kitchen looks like. Outside looked abandoned since there was garbage spread out in front of the entrance.

As soon as we walked in Brittany greeted us with a warm and friendly welcome. We had the Pasta Ditali and the Chicken Pomodri recommended by Brittany. 
The flavor was unbelievable, the Pasta Ditali was cooked in olive oil and white wine........delicious.  The service was a 5+
Love the place.  Reminds me of the old time bakeries from my childhood in the 50s.  Everything good there.  Everyone nice there.  Pastries are the best. Pies excellent.  They close early.

Decided to try this place rather than the donut experiment on Clearwater beach and that was the worst decision we made. We were one of the first customers and the donuts were cold, the toppings were stale (the captain crunch & fruity pebbles). The only thing I really wanted was maple bacon but they didn't have bacon which seems odd being that is was an early Saturday morning. We asked for suggestions and the cashiers had none so we had to go to the Facebook page to get ideas. The donuts are extremely expensive and this was my cheat meal. I threw half of it away, it wasn't even worth the calories and sugar. I will never go back here and I don't suggest you waste your money.

The food was very good.  The bruschetta is a must have, also the ratatouille salad was amazing.  This place is good, but it is not the place to go and have a filet and potatoes.  You absolutely must go out on a limb and get something more adventurous.  That being said,  I believe that this is a place for the food connoisseur that does not mind paying a higher price.  Great service, food, and drinks, but priced a little too high ($11 dollars for a drink at the bar, and then the service charge added at the table- costing about an average of $14 a drink at the table).  I do not mind paying extra for good food and service, but on the drinks- I really do not see the reason.

The service was slow and it wasn't that busy. Home frys burnt and charred when I told the waitress she just looked at me like ole well! Order came with wrong toast informed waitress, finally got the correct toast when we were done with our meal. Don't recommend the food wasn't that good.

I came here during the afternoon when bourbon wasn't quite as rowdy. There was a live band playing which was nice and pleasant. I tried a poboy and some jambalaya with French fries. I didn't care for the jambalaya, but I'd probably give this place another try.  Cool atmosphere too

So it finally happened. I finally got myself some pho (did you know it's pronounced 'fah' ? Now you do), and I've been craving it ever since. If you're ever cold, sick, or just want to look like a savage consuming soup, I suggest you do the same. 

 I came by here with my uncle one Friday night, and the place wasn't too crowded. There's a lot to choose from on the menu, but I was set on my first round of pho, and I went with the shrimp, he went for chicken. We also decided on a pork and shallot summer roll (definitely a good choice). As far as pricing, I think they're very fair, except I could have used one or two more shrimp (in actuality another ten would've been great, but I'm trying not to be greedy). 

Im just going to point out that halfway through our slurping extravaganza my uncle decided to google the proper way to eat pho. That's recommended too, in case you're also a first timer. I'm still not quite a pro, but I'm making some big steps. Regardless of how ridiculous I looked, the soup was worth it. The broth was extremely tasty, and I loved the hot sauces and toppings they provide you with. We were both full of warm liquid happiness. I'm just gonna end on that note.
Great food. I was lucky enough to get there at the start of Stone Crab season and they had some available. They were delicious. My wife and I dine here every time we visit St. Pete!

This is a bar - and mostly adheres to any expectations one would have going to a place called Two Stones Pub. Atmosphere and layout are ok. Nice booths offer a modicum if privacy for a four person get together. Outdoor dining option if weather is nice. Food is good, somewhat forgettable but gets points for inventiveness here and there. Despite lengthy beer list, choices not that great. Many choices over-hopped. "Local" does not always equate to good. But we'll stick with FOUR stars because I'll happily be going back.
Delicious all the food was great thanksgiving balls are better than the blue balls and the pork chop is to die for our waiter was the best and come to find out one of the owners definitely a must try
Beautiful outdoor setting. Breakfast dishes were perfect. Latte and cappuccino were very good. Service impeccable.

Burger bar at Gallo's , this was my second time there , bar tender was nice and friendly , the burger was awesome. My wife and son got different Burgers. They were very pleased with the food. And waffle fries were good our friends loved the place too. Waffle fries with cheese and Caesar salad with baked chicken was awesome too. I would go back again and again

I LOVE this place and I've only been once but plan on returning again and again! We went to see Scott Pemberton and his amazing guitar play to a quaint but fun loving crowd of people. The space is beautiful, the vibe is positive and contagious and the spirits flow generously. Sound system was very good and I'm thrilled to have found this gem. Having just moved from Tahoe where I was a regular at the Crystal Bay Club, I am heartened to know there is an equally awesome space to listen to music, dance with friends and meet new people. I love the outdoor space as well in case you want to get some fresh air and have deeper conversation if so needed. It looks like it's also a great place to come for happy hour or a chill evening of pool and drinks. I look forward to the next big social, musical event!

I'll say it- I've never been to a Greek restaurant before. That said, I am ready to try more Greek cuisine after my lunch at Pappoule's, regardless of how 'casual' it was. I ordered the gyro with tzatziki sauce (convinced by popular recommendation). I wasn't too sure of what to expect but I was glad to see some nice looking food. The gyro was packed with meat and the sauce was awesome. To finish up, I had some baklava which was decent, though I have no reference for this.

Fast, affordable Greek food that is sure to satisfy.
So grateful for this new delicious and healthy neighborhood restaurant! Excellent grilled vegetable salad, Cobb salad, and kids meals! Looking forward to ordering again soon!

I give up... This is the Umpteenth time they have botched a simple order for me or my employees. I own a company in town that has 22+ employees and we order from time to time with more mistakes from Legacy than not. Today I ordered a egg,cheese and spinach on a roll and instead they put scrapple. I am repulsed by this. I am utterly perplexed as to why they would randomly put scrapple on my sandwich.

Horrible!! Went twice and both times we had to send our food back because it was cold!!! And then got cold food all over again!  First time shame on them; second time shame on me!!! The service is horrible. I'm sure if we would've been served hot meals the food would have been so much better. I'll never return and neither will any of my family members.
I think this might be the best coffee I've had. Along with exceptional service! I found my new coffee spot for trips down here!

So obviously this isn't high end, life changing, memory making Chinese food. But, this is hands down the best mall chinese food I have ever had. When I am in a rush in cool springs, sometimes I swing by the food court and get their lo mein noodles and bourbon chicken. And it's always been fresh and tasty. 

I know they make everything fresh, because I see them chopping up raw chicken in the back. It's also such a great price, because it's enough food to last me two meals and is only like 7 bucks after tax. 

The people that serve there are so kind and always smiling. This is def my go to mall food place!

I was headed for the Japanese place next door but noticed this Vietnamese spot was a bit busier, so I gave it a try. Should have stuck w/Plan A !
Seated right away & jasmine tea ordered. Then nothing ?  Waiter finally showed up w/my hot tea & promptly left w/o taking my order. He finally appeared & I ordered the vermicelli bowl. There I sat for another 15 minutes, heard the ding of the order in the kitchen (at this point folks had cleared out). Nothing 
My waiter was flirting w/the one lone guy at the bar, chatting it up & I had to wave him down to ask to check on my food. 
Again, in no rush finally came out with it 
Disappointing at best. Two small grilled shrimp, one tiny egg roll cut in 1/2 & overcooked/dry pork on top of the rice noodles. The sauce was tasty but for a lunch price of $18 just not what I was hoping for 
Won't be back. I have found other Vietnamese spots in St Pete w/way more tasty food for a much better price & prompt service.

Brunch here is amazing! I had the three cheese lobster scramble with sweet pepper hash. It was delicious. My husband had the special, a croque madame. Everything was delightful, and our server, Kenny was helpful and prompt. The bloody marys are fantastic. We're never disappointed with The Birch and Vine.

I absolutely adore the ice cream here. Despite being slightly lactose, I can never no to the creaminess and delicious flavors of the ice cream here. My personal favorites right now are the earl grey tea and shortbread cookies or the Brazilian coffee. The tea and coffee flavors are so strong and delicious!

I am SO beyond thrilled that the Mesa finally has fro-yo!! The Lovin Spoonful blows Yogurtland so far out of the water - great flavors, fresh toppings, clean and bright environment. Oh, and very friendly staff!!! Love this place!!!

I never thought an olive oil shop could be this cool.

Hell, I didn't even know there was such a thing as an olive oil shop!

You can sample every kind of olive oil or balsamic that they carry in the store. The couple that owns the shop is really friendly and helpful, and they give you a punch-out card so you can get a free bottle once you've purchased 12. I've tried everything in the shop, but my favorite is the garlic infused olive oil. I cook with it constantly.... in fact, I've just run out, so I'll be heading back to Olive-n-Grape pretty soon!

Stopped in a few times while staying of Magazine Street, enjoyed the coffee, leather lounge chairs and vibe.  When overcharged, the staff was quick to remedy the bill and shared an extra biscotti as a treat.

We have two cats who have been taken care of by Hamilton Vet for 11 years now.  Our youngest cat was in a very bad situation that North Star couldn't figure out.  Dr. Moon brought him back from the brink.  I have always felt the office staff cared for my pets as much as I do.  I highly recommend Hamilton Veterinary Hospital.

My boyfriend and I ate here last night, Wednesday, January 30 at around 8:30. The restaurant did not have any other customers at this time so we weren't sure if they were about to close. But the doors were open and we were greeted by the most friendly crew. We asked if they were about to close. They said nope, come on in. Even though the restaurant was dead,  the guys did not act like we were an inconvenience or anything. And we were even using a coupon. Lol.
If you like the service you receive at Chick-fil-A, these guys totally matched or exceeded that level.
Burgers and fries were great, and it made us even more satisfied with our meal after being taken care of by such a nice crew.
Not sure who the owner of this Backyard Burger is, but these guys definitely deserve some recognition for customer service.

This has become my go to place for lunch. I have been here over a dozen times and tried most of the menu and have never had anything I didn't like. The spinach and artichoke soup is delicious and my favorite sandwich is the French Dip. The portions are large and the staff is very friendly.

They told us 20 minutes but after 50 minutes they told me they still had no idea as several parties were ahead of us.  I can understand a wait when a place is busy, but they lied to us about the wait hoping we'd stay.  We were leaving but they chased us down and said a table was now ready.  The waitress was nice but the food was nothing special.  Won't be going back!
Whenever I'm in St Louis I always treat myself to a cup of Ted Drewes' Frozen Custard. This is better than ice cream. This time I selected Pineapple "concrete" Frozen Custard and it was so delicious.

10/5/19- dinner 

Another amazing meal at JC's  Three Square Meals! I took my friend Ann here for the first time and it did not disappoint! I'm sorry I can't remember the name of our server but she was very sweet.

We ordered the mozzarella fried cheese coated in panko bread crumbs. Fresh basil and fresh tomatoes complimented the appetizer as well as some savory tomato sauce/dip. 

We each chose the shrimp wrap with plump shrimp, avocado, lettuce, bacon and this delicious poblano cream sauce. The shrimp knocked me out with how fresh tasting it was. I haven't had better shrimp at the seashore even. I would definitely order this again and I loved the fresh in house cooked potato chips. I got extra poblano sauce and was dipping my chips in that zippy addicting creamy zesty poblano cream sauce.

My friend was super impressed! I'm eager to go back. I saw the chicken and waffles served to our neighboring table along with sandwiches piled so high I don't think anyone's mouth could fit around it.  

Service was attentive and friendly. Keep in mind- things are cooked from scratch, so please allow time for fresh food preparation. 

The owner, Joe, came by to check on us. It's really delightful to see a business that's so customer focused. We were speaking to him and his visit really made us feel special.

Are for lunch.  Pizza by the slice was good and had a lot of choices.  Pepperoni breadsticks were delicious. Family owned and operated.  Have it so kids can make their own pizzas.  Prices were reasonable.  Definitely coming back for dinner to try a homemade calzone and past!

Goodness, this ice cream place is delicious. Located inside the Santa Barbara Public Market Rori's really does dominate the ice cream scene here in the downtown area. I don't know if they are organic or just have some great crazy flavors but it was delicious, smooth and extra creamy. Today we had the passionfruit (looks like vanilla) and the lavender honey which apparently is a big hit here generally as everyone was asking for it. My brother got a root beer float. They have all other sorts of neat treats including cookie sundaes. They have a small number of seatings there in the air conditioned insides but a lot of people opted to sit outside. Just a great place to stop by and encourage all of you to do so!
I did a catering order of chicken strips, nuggets and cookies and they forgot the cookies. The food is great though!

Best BBQ I've had. Staff was very friendly and food was literally to die for.     has the brisket plate with baked beans and cornbread.  7 yr old daughter had kids single burger and mac n cheese and love them both.  I don't think I have ever seen her eat that much food.

First time I came here I had the shrimp and grits, which was fantastic! So fantastic I begged my boyfriend to take me back... Second time was horrible. First off the service was bad, the waiter only came 3 times: to put water on the table, take our order, and give us the bill. The rest of the time we had to flag down anyone passing by. It took us SO LONG to get our food we had to pay to extend our parking (mind you we only got one thing) When our food finally came out a random waitress gave our food to a man sitting next to us (he ordered the chicken and waffles as well) and the man even told her we had been waiting a really long time, she should give us the food. She told us the other chicken and waffles was coming out right now...another 20 minutes went by, and we finally got it. We had to flag down another waitress to let us see a manager. We talked to him and he asked if we wanted anything. I asked could we get a slice of carrot cake which I had wanted in the first place. I NEVER EVEN GOT IT. But our meal did end up being free. The food is pretty good but the service was HORRENDOUS they need to do better.

We went to Hammerstone's last night to catch up with some friends for dinner and drinks. We were there around 8p and found a table quickly. Other than the server taking ~15 minutes to come to our table initially, we had a pleasant experience. The drink specials didn't start until 10p, so the four of us had some beers and our food was ordered quickly. The appetizer of onion rings came quickly and they were delicious! Not too much breading and fried to the perfect crispness! For dinner we had 2 burgers, 1 chicken philly, and 1 marinated artichoke hoagie. The server was perfectly attentive throughout the meal, and the food was good and priced well. One of the best aspects of the evening was Naked Mike, the live band playing. They played some great music and the volume was perfect to continue holding a conversation. Overall it was a good experience and we'll most likely be back to try out the patio in the warmer months!

While Yard House is a chain restaurant and my husband and I typically don't eat at chain restaurants, We break that rule with Yard House. We have eaten at several locations and have been impressed with all locations. I typically eat the vegan burger and most times it is good however, this time it was very salty. I hardly ate any of it. The fries are absolutely delicious! My husband ate a steak taco and a chicken taco. He said he would get those again for sure. Friends we ate with got the BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger, the Chicken Sand which and the Pork Tacos. All of which was great. 

We typically just get appetizers and have drinks on football Sundays. They have a huge bar with lots of local brews. Great place to dine by yourself, with friends or family or just to watch a game. It's a must try!!
Not very impressed it was a very bad dinning experiance. It started with the rude hostess to the really bad food. The only good part was the waitress she was so nice and attentive.

The service was ok, my waiter was halfway listening, I asked for very spicy wings she came back with flavorless wings. My date had a t-bone steak that also had no season but the mashed potatoes was delicious!!!

Great brunch. Small, quaint restaurant with an excellent, friendly team providing attentive service. The menu has typical brunch classic and NOLA specialities. The catfish po'boy was the best that I had in the area. The Bloody Mary was huge and heavy on the spice and garnishing.

I know it's a chain, so I'll try to be nice... 

Here is a classic example of where poor service completely spoils the enjoyment of good food. First off, I love love love their souffles. However, their selection is almost completely depleted by 10:00. And (some of) the people who work here are crazy rude. Case in point: asked for a toasted pecan roll. The cashiers response? "We have a microwave." 

Otherwise a nice addition to an otherwise unassuming strip mall in suburbia.

This place finally reopened.  I'm always looking for a cheap dinner near my house for night when I don't feel like cooking.  I ordered breakfast for dinner.  I got an amazingly fresh stack of pancakes, eggs and sausage patties for $5.50.  I could not finish it all.  My boyfriend ordered the huge chicken fried steak breakfast.  If the menu had not said huge, he would have thought it was a good size.  Compared to Black Bear Diner, the chicken fried steak was not huge or as flavorful.

My boyfriend liked my pancakes so much, we went for breakfast the next morning.  This time, the place was packed with a large party.  We had to wait a little longer than normal for our food, but the waitress was very up front about the wait.  I'm sure over time, the chefs will get up to speed.

I find it weird that they have a jumbo sign stating the owners is a famous chef on the food channel.  The waitress said he was famous for stuffed burgers.  I couldn't find anything online regarding the famous chef.

Great new addition which has me becoming a regular. The Beyond Meat burger is the best tasting BURGER period!! If your thinking of getting healthy but with no compromise, then the Beyond Burger is for you!!

Have been here a few times - great greasy burgers and open really late.  

They take a long time to grill the burgers, it gets really loud on the weekends.  

Really great selection of diverse cheeses and toppings - gruyere, bleu etc for a gourmet burger joint.  Definitely full flavor but they do have turkey burgers too.
If you are looking for a great burger and a pint of beer this place is a great spot to check out.

I walk in they see me, I go pay and then pick my coffee up in two minutes. Can't ask for more. One of the guys who is been working there for a while, and is been making my coffee all the time almost, u will be missed buddy. Thanks for making my frap  always delicious
This used to be my favorite place. I just stopped and got my usual. The scoops were ridiculously tiny!

Well after eating at every other restaurant in Maplewood, it was only a matter of time before I made it to The Crow's nest. This is not ur typical bar grub establishment....its atypical!

They offer a lot out of a very small kitchen. I started with their fried deviled eggs appetizer...very good...just a little crunch to bite through and bam...a nice moist egg center. It's topped with a small piece of bacon for another type of crunch and flavor...another bam! 

My entree was a special 7oz. strip steak sandwich with a side of smashed potatoes...bam bam! 

It was a really good meal that was complimented by great wait service. I had fun and tasty event that didn't cost a lot! Bam! Bam! Bam!

I've been to many different boba tea shops and 3 others alone in Tampa. This is my favorite! It is a little more expensive but definitely worth it. Big serving size and the tastiest of all boba teas. I love the red rose tea, it smells like flowers and tastes delicious! Their boba beads are never hard, always cooked just right, and sweetened unlike any other boba!!! It's a must try! the beads I believe are sweetened with honey and it makes a huge difference in the taste! Highly recommend! Good study space as well, although occasionally gets loud intermittently.
